channel.title: Lessig News
channel.description: Columns, interviews, relevant articles, news on Lessig.
channel.dc:creator: elaine

item.title: "Technology Over Ideology"
item.description: In Prof. Lessig's latest column for Wired, he writes about FCC chair Michael Powell....
item.content:encoded: In Prof. Lessig's latest column for Wired, he writes about FCC chair Michael Powell.
item.dc:creator: elaine

item.title: Law & Blogging
item.description: Professor Lessig spoke at Bloggercon about the law and blogging....
item.content:encoded: Professor Lessig spoke at Bloggercon about the law and blogging.

item.title: (Re)Creativity : How Creativity Lives
item.description: Prof. Lessig gave a presentation to the Hans Christian Andersen Academy in November 2004....
item.content:encoded: Prof. Lessig gave a presentation to the Hans Christian Andersen Academy in November 2004.
item.dc:creator: elaine

item.title: Sample the Future
item.description: Wired Magazine writes about "The Wired CD" which includes songs produced under the Creative Commons License. They reference Professor Lessig...
item.content:encoded: Wired Magazine writes about "The Wired CD" which includes songs produced under the Creative Commons License. They reference Professor Lessig as the founder of Creative Commons.
item.dc:creator: elaine

item.title: Hollywood Fights Video, Movie Piracy
item.description: Prof. Lessig expresses his concern about the government's war on piracy in this NPR interview....
item.content:encoded: Prof. Lessig expresses his concern about the government's war on piracy in this NPR interview.
item.dc:creator: elaine

item.title: How I Learned to Love Larry
item.description: Hilary Rosen, ex-CEO of the RIAA, writes about how she's grown to love Creative Commons and Prof. Lessig. In this...
item.content:encoded: Hilary Rosen, ex-CEO of the RIAA, writes about how she's grown to love Creative Commons and Prof. Lessig. In this article, Prof. Lessig also writes how copyrights can inspire the next digital revolution.
item.dc:creator: elaine

item.title: Web Publishers Fear 'A Little Sharing'
item.description: Professor Lessig is quoted in this article about the community use of passwords and registration information....
item.content:encoded: Professor Lessig is quoted in this article about the community use of passwords and registration information.
item.dc:creator: elaine

item.title: Tech Goes to the Polls
item.description: Prof. Lessig backs the new P2P Politics Web site in a story written by CNET....
item.content:encoded: Prof. Lessig backs the new P2P Politics Web site in a story written by CNET.
item.dc:creator: elaine

item.title: "Copyright and the Mouse"
item.description: Professor Lessig is quoted in this article about copyright law and MickeyMouse....

item.title: "Threats to Media Freedom"
item.description: PC World writes about Professor Lessig's appearance at Web 2.0 in San Francisco. It is included in article about Chief...
item.content:encoded: PC World writes about Professor Lessig's appearance at Web 2.0 in San Francisco. It is included in article about Chief Yahoo Jerry Yang's reflection on the company's first ten years at Web 2.0.
item.dc:creator: elaine

item.title: "A sharing approach to copyright"
item.description: The BBC interviewed Prof. Lessig in their "Go Digital" program about Creative Commons and the recent UK launch....
item.content:encoded: The BBC interviewed Prof. Lessig in their "Go Digital" program about Creative Commons and the recent UK launch.

item.title: Creative Commons UK

item.title: "Our Kids Are in Big Trouble"
item.description: Professor Lessig's latest Wired column is now online. "Our Kids Are in Big Trouble" discusses how the government is using...
item.content:encoded: Professor Lessig's latest Wired column is now online. "Our Kids Are in Big Trouble" discusses how the government is using technology to burden their future.
item.dc:creator: elaine

item.title: "This Compilation CD is Meant to Be Copied and Shared"
item.description: The Wall Street Journal quotes Professor Lessig in this story about the Creative Commons compilation CD....
